<p>Let, <svg width="4.88ex" height="2.887ex" viewBox="0 -869.3 2101 1243" role="img" focusable="false" style="vertical-align: -0.868ex;" aria-hidden="true"><defs><path stroke-width="1" If x is even, then F(x) = 0. If x is odd, then F(x) = the number of consecutive 1's at end of the binary of the odd integer. 573Q186 568 160 563T102 556H83V602H102Q149 604 189 617T245 641T273 663Q275 666 285 666Q294 666 302 660V361L303 61Q310 54 315 52T339 48T401 46H427V0H416Q395 3 257 3Q121 3 100 0H88V46H114Q136 46 152 46T177 47T193 50T201 52T207 57T213 61V578Z"></path></defs><g stroke="currentColor" fill="currentColor" stroke-width="0" transform="matrix(1 0 0 -1 0 0)"><use xlink:href="#E15-MJMAIN-32" x="0" y="0"></use><g transform="translate(500,393)"><use transform="scale(0.707)" xlink:href="#E15-MJMAIN-33"></use><use transform="scale(0.707)" xlink:href="#E15-MJMAIN-30" x="500" y="0"></use></g><use xlink:href="#E15-MJMAIN-2212" x="1530" y="0"></use><use xlink:href="#E15-MJMAIN-31" x="2531" y="0"></use></g></svg>, we need at most 30 operations of the first type to make A[i] even.</p>
<p>Let, Dp[i] denotes minimum number of operations to make all the first i elements even = Dp[i - 1] + F(A[i]).</p>
<p>Now we will apply the second type of operation to decrease the value of Dp[i]. Note that the XOR of two odd integers is even. Let <svg width="4.966ex" height="2.887ex" viewBox="0 -869.3 2138 1243" role="img" focusable="false" style="vertical-align: -0.868ex;" aria-hidden="true"><defs><path stroke-width="1" id="E16-MJMATHI-47" d="M50 252Q50 367 117 473T286 641T490 704Q580 704 633 653Q642 643 648 636T656 626L657 623Q660 623 684 649Q691 655 699 663T715 679T725 690L740 705H746Q760 705 760 698Q760 694 728 221Q156 173 170 136T206 79T256 45T308 28T353 24Q407 24 452 47T514 106Q517 114 529 161T541 214Q541 222 528 224T468 227H431Q425 233 425 235T427 254Q431 267 437 273H454Q494 271 594 271Q634 271 659 271T695 272T707 272Q721 272 721 263Q721 261 719 249Q714 230 709 228Q706 227 694 227Q674 227 653 224Q646 221 643 215T629 164Q620 131 614 108Q589 6 586 3Q584 1 581 1Q571 1 553 21T530 52Q530 53 528 52T522 47Q448 -22 322 -22Q201 -22 126 55T50 252Z"></path><path stroke-width="1" id="E16-MJMAIN-28" d="M94 250Q94 319 104 381T127 488T164 576T202 643T244 695T277 729T302 750H315H319Q333 750 333 741Q333 738 316 720T275 667T226 581T184 443T167 250T184 58T225 -81T274 -167T316 -220T333 -241Q333 -250 318 -250H315H302L274 -226Q180 -141 137 -14T94 250Z"></path><path stroke-width="1" id="E16-MJMATHI-78" d="M52 289Q59 331 106 386T222 442Q257 442 286 424T329 379Q371 442 430 442Q467 442 494 420T522 361Q522 332 508 314T481 292T458 288Q439 288 427 299T415 328Q415 374 465 391Q454 404 425 404Q412 404 406 402Q368 386 350 336Q290 115 290 78Q290 50 306 38T341 26Q378 26 414 59T463 140Q466 150 469 151T485 153H489Q504 153 504 145Q504 144 502 134Q486 77 440 33T333 -11Q263 -11 227 52Q186 -10 133 -10H127Q78 -10 57 16T35 71Q35 103 54 123T99 143Q142 143 142 101Q142 81 130 66T107 46T94 41L91 40Q91 39 97 36T113 29T132 26Q168 26 194 71Q203 87 217 139T245 247T261 313Q266 340 266 352Q266 380 251 392T217 404Q177 12T224 -76T186 -143T145 -194T113 -227T90 -246Q87 -249 86 -250H74Q66 -250 63 -250T58 -247T55 -238Q56 -237 66 -225Q221 -64 221 250T66 725Q56 737 55 738Q55 746 60 749Z"></path></defs><g stroke="currentColor" fill="currentColor" stroke-width="0" transform="matrix(1 0 0 -1 0 0)"><use xlink:href="#E16-MJMATHI-47" x="0" y="0"></use><use xlink:href="#E16-MJMAIN-28" x="786" y="0"></use><use xlink:href="#E16-MJMATHI-78" x="1176" y="0"></use><use xlink:href="#E16-MJMAIN-29" x="1748" y="0"></use></g></svg> denotes the minimum number of the first type of operations required to make the integer x odd. So we will traverse the previous 30 indices j before the i-th index, try to make A[j] and A[i] odd with G(A[j]) and G(A[i]) operations respectively, now to take XOR of them we need to apply the second type of operation (i - j) times on index j. Hence we can update:</p>
<ul>

</ul>

### Author Solution

<pre><code>
#include&lt;bits/stdc++.h&gt;
using namespace std;

int main() {
#ifndef ONLINE_JUDGE
  freopen("ip1.txt", "r", stdin);
  freopen("out1.txt", "w", stdout);
#endif
  int t;
  cin &gt;&gt; t;
  while (t--) {
    int n;
    cin &gt;&gt; n;
    vector&lt;int&gt; dp(n + 1);
    vector&lt;vector&lt;int&gt;&gt; op(n + 1, vector&lt;int&gt;(2, 1e9));
    for (int i = 1; i &lt;= n; i++) {
      int x; cin &gt;&gt; x;
      for (int j = 0; j &lt;= 30; j++, x /= 2) {
        op[i][x % 2] = min(op[i][x % 2], j);
      }
      dp[i] = dp[i - 1] + op[i][0];
      // making the A[i] even with the operation A[i] = A[i] / 2
      for (int j = i - 1; j &gt;= max(1, i - 30); j--) {
        // applying the XOR operation
        // to make a even element, we need to take XOR of two odd elements
        dp[i] = min(dp[i], dp[j - 1] + op[i][1] + op[j][1] + i - j);
        if (op[j][1] == 0) break;
        // we got an odd element on index j.
      }
    }
    cout &lt;&lt; dp[n] &lt;&lt; '\n';
  }
  return 0;
}
</code></pre>

### Tester Solution

<pre><code>
#include &lt;bits/stdc++.h&gt;
#include &lt;ext/pb_ds/assoc_container.hpp&gt; 
#include &lt;ext/pb_ds/tree_policy.hpp&gt; 
using namespace std;
using namespace __gnu_pbds;
#define int long long int
#define ordered_set tree&lt;int, nuint_type,less&lt;int&gt;, rb_tree_tag,tree_order_statistics_node_update&gt; 
mt19937 rng(std::chrono::duration_cast&lt;std::chrono::nanoseconds&gt;(chrono::high_resolution_clock::now().time_since_epoch()).count());
#define mp make_pair
#define pb push_back
#define F first
#define S second
const int N=1000005;
#define M 1000000007
#define BINF 1e16
#define init(arr,val) memset(arr,val,sizeof(arr))
#define MAXN 17500001
#define deb(xx) cout &lt;&lt; #xx &lt;&lt; " " &lt;&lt; xx &lt;&lt; "\n";
const int LG = 22;


int toEven(int a) {
    int c = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i &lt; 30; i++) {
        if(a &amp; (1LL &lt;&lt; i)) {
            c = c + 1;
        } else break;
    }
    return c;
}

int toOdd(int a) {
    int c = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i &lt; 30; i++) {
        if(!(a &amp; (1LL &lt;&lt; i))) {
            c = c + 1;
        } else break;
    }
    return c;
}


void solve() {

    int n;
    cin &gt;&gt; n;
    vector&lt;int&gt; a(n + 1), even(n + 1, 0), odd(n + 1, 0);
    for(int i = 1; i &lt;= n; i++) {
        cin &gt;&gt; a[i];
        even[i] = toEven(a[i]);
        odd[i] = toOdd(a[i]);
    }
    vector&lt;int&gt; dp(n + 1, 0);

    for(int i = 1; i &lt;= n; i++) {
        int val = dp[i - 1] + even[i];
        for(int j = i - 2; j &gt;= max(0LL, i - 32); j--) {
            val = min(val, dp[j] + (i - j - 1) + odd[j + 1] + odd[i]);
            if(odd[j + 1] == 0) break;
        }
        dp[i] = val;
    }

    int ans = dp[n];
    cout &lt;&lt; ans &lt;&lt; endl;

}


#undef int 
int main() {
#define int long long int
ios_base::sync_with_stdio(false); 
cin.tie(0); 
cout.tie(0);
#ifndef ONLINE_JUDGE
    freopen("input.txt", "r", stdin);
    freopen("optput.txt", "w", stdout);
#endif


    int T;
    cin &gt;&gt; T;
 
    for(int tc = 1; tc &lt;= T; tc++){
        // cout &lt;&lt; "Case #" &lt;&lt; tc &lt;&lt; ": ";
        solve();
    }


return 0;  
 
}
</code></pre>
